meanings.definition: Not giving way to pressure, stubbornly persistent
meanings.sent1: The old tree stood unyieldingly in the storm, refusing to bend.
meanings.sent2: She held onto her beliefs unyieldingly, despite others trying to change her mind.
meanings.sent3: The unyieldingly stubborn cat refused to eat anything but tuna.
meanings.sent4: His unyieldingly strong will was like a rock in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The unyieldingly determined athlete crossed the finish line first, despite the odds against him.

meanings.definition: Inflexibly rigid or firm in attitude or opinion
meanings.sent1: The unyieldingly strict teacher never allowed any exceptions to the rules.
meanings.sent2: He was unyieldingly opposed to any changes in the traditional way of doing things.
meanings.sent3: The unyieldingly serious clown couldn't crack a smile no matter what.
meanings.sent4: Her unyieldingly fixed gaze made it clear she would not back down.
meanings.sent5: The unyieldingly stern judge delivered the verdict without a hint of emotion.
